Class Cal

  • java.lang.Object
    • Cal

  • public class Cal
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used for calculating the many formulas used in the game. All it does is these calculations, most of which are needed in battle. ToDo: add modifier calcs to damnCal

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cal

        public Cal()
        Constructor for the calc object. It builds the statEffects hashmap and the hitStatEffects hashmap which are used in method of the class.

    • Method Detail

      • damCal

        public int damCal(int lv,
         int atk,
         int def,
         int base)
        This method calculates damage of a pokemon using a damaging move. It converts the provided ints to doubles for most of the calculation, as to get results that dont end up rounding down to zero.
        Parameters:
        lv - Level of the attacking pokemon.
        atk - Attack stat of attacking pokemon.
        def - Defense stat of defending pokemon.
        base - the power of the move the attacker is using.
        Returns:
        int damage calculated by the method.

      • statRecal

        public int statRecal(int count,
            int amnt,
            int stat)
        This method recalcuates a pokemon's stat, after it has been affected by a stat effecting move. It is the 'damage' of one of those moves. It does its internal calculations with doubles, so things dont round out to zero. note, moves that increase stats are also done here. the increase is damage.
        Parameters:
        count - the level of stat damage the pokemon being effected is at.
        amnt - the amount of stat damage done, in level difference.
        stat - stat value that is being modified.
        Returns:
        int the new stat value.

      • hitStatRecal

        public double hitStatRecal(int count,
                  int amnt,
                  double stat)
        This method recalculates the accuracy or evasion stat of a pokemon. It is the stat damage of an accuracy or evasion modifying move. It does its internal calculations with doubles, so things dont round out to zero. note, moves that increase stats are also done here. the increase is damage.
        Parameters:
        count - the level of stat damage the pokemon being effected is at.
        amnt - the amount of stat damage done, in level difference.
        stat - stat value that's being modified.
        Returns:
        double the new stat value.

      • hitMiss

        public boolean hitMiss(Move move,
              int mon,
              double[] acc,
              double[] eva)
        This method calculated the miss chance of a pokemon's move, and then generates a random number to check against it. Weither or not the move hits is returned as a boolean.
        Parameters:
        move - the move being used.
        mon - A flag for the pokemon that's hit miss is being calculated. It's used in getting values from the two arrays.
        acc - the accuracy array of the battle.
        eva - the evasion array of the battle.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the move hits, or false if it doesn't.

      • running

        public boolean running(int s1,
              int s2,
              int c)
        method that calculates the odds of running for the players pokemon, and returns a boolean for weither of not it is successful.
        Parameters:
        s1 - speed of the running pokemon.
        s2 - speed of the opponent pokemon.
        c - the count of run attempts.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the pokemon escapes, false if not.
